meanings.definition: The state or quality of being multicellular.
meanings.sent1: The multicellularities of the organism allow for specialized functions in different cell types.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the multicellularities of plants to understand how they grow and develop.
meanings.sent3: The multicellularities of the tissue made it look like a tiny city under the microscope.
meanings.sent4: The multicellularities of the coral reef create a vibrant and diverse ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: Learning about the multicellularities of animals helps us appreciate the complexity of life forms.

meanings.definition: The presence of multiple cells in an organism.
meanings.sent1: The multicellularities of the human body allow for different organs to work together.
meanings.sent2: Biologists study the multicellularities of various organisms to understand their structures.
meanings.sent3: The multicellularities of the plant made it seem like a tiny forest in the lab.
meanings.sent4: The multicellularities of the sponge create a strong and resilient structure.
meanings.sent5: Examining the multicellularities of bacteria helps in understanding their growth and reproduction.
